result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin M. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE IF NOT ALREADY DONE

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Anderson, Benjamin M.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin M. Anderson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Benjamin M. Anderson in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that parties have resolution today.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement. Atty Hendee states that the PSI is being waived by both counsel today.  Atty Gumz agrees and states that the defendant is in Prison at this time.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is waiving his right to a PSI.  Atty Gumz makes sentencing arugments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions; consecutive to his current Prison sentence and concurrent to his current Probation case:
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample (if not already done) + $250 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
PSI will not be ordered.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

Final pre-trial at 02-05-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 03-10-2016 08:30 am.

Atty Hendee states that the defendant is in custody in Green Lake County.  Atty Gumz responds and will have a court date in Green Lake County October 12th.

BY THE COURT: Set for Jury Trial
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states he spoke with his client today out of Green Lake County Jail.  There are other matters pending there.  Requests further return date.  
BY THE COURT:  Reset return date.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states defendant is currently in the Green Lake County Jail.  Atty Gumz anticipates further discussion with his attorney there.  Requests adjournment for 60 days.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Return date scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin M. Anderson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Bonnett files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Benjamin M. Anderson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant regarding the time limits for the Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set for Prelim.
